title: Exploring the Relationship Between Teaching Presence and Academic Achievement in Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational digital literacy and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: A research-based educational program analyzing the impact of instructor interaction methods on academic achievement within immersive simulation environments for language learning.

learning_goals: Learners distinguish and explain the three sub-elements of teaching presence (design/organization, discourse facilitation, direct instruction) in a VR-based simulation environment.
Learners self-assess their level of teaching presence in online learning experiences using a 5-point Likert scale.
Learners propose at least three strategies to enhance teaching presence based on formative assessment feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
